abstract: Thomas P. DiNapoli, the New York State comptroller, spent much of his first debate with the Republican challenger, Harry Wilson, denouncing the former hedge fund manager as “a wizard of Wall Street” who could not be trusted.
snippet: Thomas P. DiNapoli, the New York State comptroller, spent much of his first debate with the Republican challenger, Harry Wilson, denouncing the former hedge fund manager as “a wizard of Wall Street” who could not be trusted.
lead_paragraph: Thomas P. DiNapoli, the New York State comptroller, spent much of his first debate with the Republican challenger, Harry Wilson, denouncing Mr. Wilson as “a wizard of Wall Street” who could not be trusted to manage the public pension fund or end the corruption that has plagued the office, The New York Times’s Sam Dolnick writes.

headline.main: Comptroller Rivals Debate Wall Street Ties
